file_content.text: Pitiful. Why did I ever believe you could change anything?
You want me dead? If that's what it takes to get rid of you... do it!
Shut up, or finish the job!
I will not gift you that release. Not yet.
This was a fraction of the pain my children can inflict. If you do not finish your training, you will feel the full weight of their rage.
This is your idea of training? Thrash me half to death until I learn my lesson?
You're a terrible teacher.
I honored my obligation, prepared you for what will come.
I cannot stay to protect you any longer. There are matters to which I must attend... but I will leave you with a final token of my favor.
Fulfill your destiny, and I promise to return.
I've had enough of your threats. I never wanted this in the first place. You can stay gone.
Stop trying to scare me.
I hope this is not the end of our journey--and one day, so will you.
Cheer up, big brother. You're making me sad.
Father won't face me himself.
He's punishing you for stealing his chair.
He isn't angry. Father never feels anything. Not even when I... when Thexan died.
He was a good brother. Brought me gifts from all the worlds he conquered.
I freed you from Father's control. I hope that earned your... support.
My loyalties lie here, Arcann. Always.
Now what?
You have no idea what I'm capable of.
You don't know me at all.
And neither do you. Therein lies the problem.
Give me some credit. It's not easy to kill a man who's already dead.
This wasn't a fair fight.
Do not mistake your defiance for courage. I do not.
You act like I didn't leave Tython as a fully-trained Jedi.
The Jedi Order prepared me.
I graduated from the Academy with top honors--and they don't hand out ranks like mine to just anyone.
I passed basic training.
I've been to every school of hard knocks in the galaxy. You've got nothing I need, old man.
I already know all I need.
Training? I know every secret of Korriban, Dromund Kaas, and all the other worlds that dared challenge me.
I have mastered the dark side.
I've taken down common thugs, giant monsters, and everything in-between. I'd say I'm done training.
Training? You're funny.
Imperial Intelligence prepared me for anything, and I haven't lost my edge.
My skills are well-honed.
You do not perceive the path ahead, even when it is obvious. Let that be your first lesson.
There's nothing you or your children can do to me that I won't survive.
I can endure anything.
Your goal is not to survive. It is to win. There is nothing else.
You can exist outside my head? Where are you going--and why?
How are you able to leave?
It is pointless to explain. You will understand, when the time comes.
When you come back, I'll be ready to finish this fight. You won't survive.
Return, and I'll destroy you.
I have never been your enemy. Remember that, and be victorious.
I bent my knee to you. I gave you my loyalty in exchange for your power.
You promised we'd be allies.
You have received all that I can give--for now. One day, there may be more. Until then....
This was a fraction of the pain my children can inflict. If you do not finish your training--become something greater--you will feel the full weight of their rage.
You keep saying I have to become more than I am, but you never explain what that means.
Something greater?
You demand a simple answer, refusing to look for it within. That is the essence of your failure.
Your goal is not to survive. It is to rule. There is nothing else.
